title: Not happy
body: Stood in doctors 15 mins then she told me to go to other window went there woman told me to go back to the one I was at first I started to tell her why I was there when she ignored me and picked the phone up There was 3 woman in the reception think they should get some manners

title: Exactly what I needed
body: Went into this with anxiety I couldn’t control that affected pretty much every aspect of my daily life, had my last session today and can say with confidence I’m in control and on top of it, and armed with the tools to put myself back in the drivers seat if I start to backslide again. Been assured I can refer myself again as well if I need anything else, incredibly grateful and able now to crack on with life without being held back by anxiety!

title: Excellent hospital
body: I had a cataract removed, on the 29th December, all the staff were friendly and helpful. I was given plenty of information before my operation and after before I went home.

title: Above and beyond
body: I received the hammer blow news that I had cancer in Nov 2020 - I started chemo in December and have two more sessions in January then radio therapy until April  - the Practice Manager has sorted a covid vaccine for me allowing me to continue to live at home for the next three months with my children (of schooling age) rather than moving out into complete isolation away from them - the help this practice provided allows me to continue with the mental positivity I need to beat this disease - thank you

title: Fabtasry
body:
I would just like to extend my thanks to the urgent walk in centre . What an amazing efficient fantastic service I received today . I had called  phoned my GP 32 times today about a very infected cyst on my head been infected for 5 days over new year etc . ( no answer , online also not working ) .. rang 111 .. advised to go to hengrove walk in centre .. 
the treatment I received was outstanding from the receptionist to the lovely male nurse I saw . The outcome was I need antibiotics etc . Just wanted to say a huge Thankyou for helping me when I had no idea where to turn . 
Amazing service ..

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient
body: Had to visit for cystoscopy. Reluctant to attend because of Covid but conditions were good. Service was very quick. Arrived 8.45am for 9.15am appt. By 9.35am I had been seen and treated and was able to leave. Impressive bearing in mind current difficulties. Couldn't ask for better at the moment.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Frustration trying to make an Appt!!!!!
body: Advised to only call between certain times of the day!  At these times the line is constantly busy. At the miracle that you do make it to the queue system - when you get to 1st place after waiting 20 minutes you are then cut off - and the phone is constantly busy AGAIN ALL DAY!!!!!!!! There are other medical issues going on OTHER THAN COVID that still need investigating before patients die!!

title: Great Practise
body: The nurse was brilliant and reassuring. She was professional and sorted everything. The nurse was knowledgeable and was able to answer all my questions.

title: Long Wait to Answer the Telephone
body: At 4.25pm today called this practice on their advertised telephone number and placed 17th in a queue.  Finally talking to the practice at 5.11 hours.   So placed for 45+ minutes on hold.  And that's not at a time when you can book an appointment with this practice.

title: Amazing care and support
body: My young daughter was suffering from coronavirus symptoms and awaiting a test the GP acted quickly treated my daughter the same day and showed care, compassion and concern after her positive result. I have been a patient at trinity medical centre for over 20 years and can honestly say my GP is the best in the business.

title: Really Helpful Staff
body: Recently I have needed help for two different conditions and on both occasions the practice receptionists, nurses and Doctors could not have been more helpful. They were also brilliant when I forgot my tablets whilst I was away and they sent an emergency prescription to a local pharmacy.

title: Outstanding practice!!!
body: My husband and I would like to express our gratitude and say a huge thank you to Greystone House Surgery Reception/ call staff, nurses, doctors and everyone at the practice for the excellent, prompt and caring service provided. I was unwell and had to consult a few times and can I just say that although they must be overwhelmed with work pressures, but they certainly try their best to provide outstanding care. The doctor never hesitated to advice me to rest and recover before heading back to work. My husband needed their service and that was dealt with promptly as well. They were genuinely concerned. We are truly grateful to have them as our GP, we can safely rely and count on them. They are truly exemplary and an example of service par excellence. Thank you Greystone, God bless you all and please keep safe.

title: Unresponsive and uncaring
body:
My parents have been registered with the Wilson St surgery since the 1960s. They are both in their 80s with medical conditions and have still yet to be contacted for their covid vaccinations despite being the highest clinical priority. The note on the website instructing patients not to enquire is insulting and uncaring.   It is not acceptable to ask vulnerable high priority pensioners to continue to wait in this health crisis without any explanation or justification. The lack of action by this surgery is perpetuating clinical risk which could result in severe health consequences and loss of life.

We know that vaccinations are available to NHS staff.  Why is this surgery not prioritising and protecting their vulnerable patients? 

A very poor show

title: 6 hour wait for triage (still waiting)
body: Had an 21 week growth scan ultrasound at 4pm. Sonography revealed an issue for review and investigation by a Doctor. Sent upstairs to triage and still here at 10pm not been seen by anyone. Ward is like the Marie Celeste. Understand there are higher priority patients but 6 hours to see a Doctor (and still we wait so could be any amount of time) seems ridiculous. Partner had to go home to get food and blankets. Poor service.

title: Great Reception Staff
body: I felt I had to say, after reading quite a few negative reviews about the ladies on reception, that over the years I've been using the surgery, I have not had any problems. On the contrary. My son suffers severe mental health issues and has for many years. The ladies on reception have been nothing but kind and understanding when I've been panicking down the phone and I cant thank them enough. Everyone has a bad day at the office once in a while!

title: In contactable via email.
body: Tried to mail you using your link. It's returned as "Undeliverable". Perhaps there's a problem with your link.

title: Fast, professional and caring
body: Several times since Covid changed all our lives my wife and I have needed a consultation at the Health Centre.  Each time the response has been "fast, professional and caring".  Just one recent example: I emailed the Health Centre with a medical problem at 11am. The doctor rang me at 11.15am and I was being seen in person at the Health Centre by 11.30am.  Back home by noon suitably advised and reassured, I’ve been singing the praises of the service I’d just received on this, and on previous occasions.  It is always a pleasure to be able to hand out compliments particularly at a time when the NHS is under such strain.  The Cobham Health Centre deserve ours and they come with our grateful thanks

title: Physio Appointment
body: My physio appointment was booked quicker than expected and the exercises given have really helped my back.  The Physio was really kind and caring.  Thank you for the great service.

title: Very Pleased.
body:
I had an appoinment that i was quite anxious about on the 04/01/2020, to do with a coil fitting. I never had it done before and because i never went to this practice previously i was very nervous about this fitting.

I had a phone call with the doctor a couple weeks in advance to book the appointment and have like the conselltation about what i will be having and the available choices and the outcomes of what could happen. They made my decision very easy to choose and even sent me over some extra information so I am aware and prepared for my appointment and have the knowledge I needed.

After having the appointment I can happily say, that i was so happy with the service, especially with the doctor who treated me. They made me feel so comfortable and explained everything I needed to know on the phone call prior, and on the day. The doctor explained everything that was going on with the procedure and it literally only lasted a couple minutes at best. The doctor continued to keep a professional, yet very friendly and welcoming manor which made the appointment so much better and made the time fly.

I'll be more then happy to go back in 8 weeks for my check up and recieve great service again.

Thank you so much.

title: Difficult to see how it can get much worse
body: As somebody who has been at the practice for over 50yrs, its shocking to see how poor its got. Mergers and changes that have caused the service to plunge. a Phone system not ever fit for purpose unless you like listing to endless messages and music at your expense, and an online system that has major issues and buffering problems. Also always claims its your internet, yet we all seem to work from home with are perfect stable internet which is fine. Reception can be very rude. prescription requests are often potluck and you have to go back again and again, as the IT doesn't work. Never get any consistency and all this in the name of improvement. I'd give minus stars If I could its that poor.

title: Terrible service
body: Went for a PAP smear that had been cancelled two times beforehand, booked in for 0830 and arrived 10 minutes early. Doors were locked and after buzzing numerous times, waiting in the January cold for 25 minutes, a receptionist finally came. She rudely told me my appointment was for 0830, which I then explained I was here, ringing the doorbell and knocking, then tried to call. Then she said 'it doesn't matter anyway because all appointments are cancelled due to COVID, so we can't see patients - there were texts sent out this morning'. I didn't receive a text, as I told her and she said 'you'll have to rebook once this is over, but your cervical smear is really important so you do have to do it' in front of another male patient!!! Absolutely appalled, and previous calls have been a nightmare due to reception's icy reception and terrible manners!!

title: Ct scan
body: I visited the CT unit  one toilet at waiting area h pull straps were filthy floor dirty wet  toilet seat , and in the whole hour and a half at the waiting area NOT ONE CLEANER     in that time cleaned or wiped down the toilet after at least 15/20 patients USED  that facility , after having there bladder filled for CT scanning ???,?

title: New telephone system
body: I was on the phone for one hour and 35 minutes and never made it to the top of the queue.  I gave up at 7.00 pm when I’d been seventh in the queue for 35 minutes.  I need to arrange a review of my medication but I won’t try ringing again because it’s too frustrating.  I’d rather do without my tablets than go through that again.

title: Uncaring and unhelpful
body: Used the walk in at the weekend as I couldn’t see out of one eye, it was inflamed and swollen. Doc said I needed to come back if it got worse and diagnosed an eye condition. Tried to get in again to see a doc today (2days later) as I’m in agony and can’t sleep, but the front desk won’t let me have an appointment! Disgusting the way untrained admin staff decide if you get to see a doctor or not. If Im left with permanent damage of any kind believe me there will be repercussions.

author: Silent Elderly
title: Denied Covid vaccination
body:
My Father aged 89 and in the top priority group for Covid 19 Vaccination was denied vaccine yesterday as he could not sign the consent form.  
Yet, he was referred to the "vaccination hub" at Croydon University Hospital straight after a outpatient appointment at the hospital with an Elderly Care Consultant.  
Why is there no procedure in place for the consent forms to be signed by a carer or doctor in the case of a patient not being deemed able to sign.  
Why was the referring member of staff not aware of the procedure at the vaccination hub.  
My Father will now have to return at a later date to get his vaccine once the procedure for him getting the vaccine is communicated to him / his carer . It is unclear who will explain the procedure and how the next vaccination appointment will be communicated to him.  
What a waste of an opportunity to vaccinate an elderly vulnerable person who was on site and ready to get the vaccine.  
Every time he leaves the house for a hospital appointment it puts him at risk, I am very disappointed that the vaccination team were unable to carry out the vaccination.  
I am his next of kin and live overseas. I have a LPOA which I messaged to his carer. The NHS system of contacting patients and making appointments is very difficult for the elderly and very hard for me to keep up with being out of the UK at this time.

author: phoenixpw78
title: The support couldn't be bettered
body:
I started my path in September 2016 and I have had full support from then right through til now. Next year I will technically be discharged because I've had everything done. Surgery, paperwork, all the forms, the GMC changed everything across.  
I have had the best of care from Professor Bowman, Dr Murjan, Dr Georgiadiou and speech therapist Ioanna. I still send them Christmas cards every year and I am very very grateful for all that they have done.  
I've had great care all the way through to my surgery, the tribunal did the paperwork and they were fantastic, everything was great. The support I have received couldn't be bettered. I know some other people have had not as good experiences, but everything went perfectly well. They documented everything.  
They all were absolutely amazing. I can't think how this could have been improved. The whole staff were brilliant, right down to the receptionists, they were all so kind, polite and supportive. It was magic.

author: reticulumrn38
title: Not drinking since using S.T.A.R.S.
body:
Key worker was brilliant  
Still not drinking since using the service

author: victoreq76
title: Keyworker was brilliant
body:
Really happy, his keyworker was brilliant  
not drank since using the service

author: deploymentpq86
title: Being understood
body:
At the beginning found it hard to have points understood  
After a while was understood and was helped

author: silverwarehe37
title: Not much contact
body:
Not much contact because of Covid 19  
On the most part dealing with life

author: gammacx57
title: Gave the platform
body: Really good. Gave him the platform to work off. Found his feet, and is now working hard on himself

author: golfrz74
title: No access
body: I could not access the Covid Check website when I tried.

title: Great experience
body: The staff were welcoming and friendly. I was seen quickly and found the nurse  and doctor to be very knowledgeable, professional and kind. The eye unit was clean and allowed for social distancing. Overall a great experience and I would like to thank the staff for helping me so efficiently.

author: Dantheman
title: Getting OPAT intravenous antibiotics
body: I had prostate cancer and had my prostate removed by robot assisted prostatectomy. However I developed an infection in my pubic symphysis could hardly walk. Was referred to OPAT at the Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy, the nurses and doctor were so caring and professional couldn't ask for better care, was there every day for 2 weeks and the nurses and the doctor were cheery every visit, this during the covid pandemic testament to there professionalism

author: Clusa90
title: Emergency operation
body:
I would like to send huge thank yous to everyone that was involved with my mum's recent stay in hospital. This is a long one just to prewarn you all!  
A couple of weeks back my mum had to be rushed down to the GP practice to be urgently seen due to an issue with her right foot. I would like to thank Dr Jegunma for her assessment and understanding with my mums issue, and how she displayed great kindness which settled my mums anxiety surrounding doctors instantly. The following morning due to not hearing so quickly as we had hoped from the hospital to see which department she was to be admitted to, I was pleased to say that ACP Pauline was on the case first thing and managed to arrange an emergency admission via ED. I’m aware she spend most of her morning sorting this out and we are all very grateful for this!  
Following blood tests and X-rays in ED mum was admitted to orthopaedics for treatment of osteomyelitis. Unfortunately the following day we were told the news that mum would lose her leg from above the knee due to critical limb ischemia and severe osteomyelitis.  
We were all shocked and devastated how quickly this happened but thanks to all the staff during her stay she made the most amazing recovery and was discharged home just in time for Christmas.  
I would like to thank everyone involved in my mums care. You were all amazing and worth your weight in gold!  
Special thank yous too (apologies as this is a long list and sorry if you are not mentioned as never got everyone’s individual names).  
ED staff- thank you to ED reg Laura, and nurses Bethan, Abigail, Fiona and Jackie! You guys made a stressful situation for my mum much more eased thank you!  
Orthopaedics ward 212- student nurse Chi for your kind welcome, FY1 John, Mr Bodie and his team - I really appreciate the time you took to call me to explain the plan with my mum. Some more thank yous to nurses Heather (day shift) and Lorna (night shift) for all your excellent care and compassion towards my mum you both helped ease a scary and stressful situation for her!  
Special thanks to David (recovery nurse) for phoning me when mum was out of theatre- I’m aware mum made you do this, but very thankful you took the time for a quick update!  
HDU ward 217- you guys are amazing at what you do! Mum was so well looked after by you all and we are so appreciative! Thanks go to Dawn, Joe, Claire, Devi and Student nurse Iona and there were so many more of you guys but can’t remember all your names I’m so sorry!  
Vascular ward 215- well you guys are amazing! Honestly what a team! Between all the doctors & nurses, your team of physios and OTs are unreal and honestly I never realised how much work you guys do and you are all fabulous! How you all supported and managed give mum back her independence after such a life changing operation is unreal and we are all so thankful! Special thank yous again to nurses Brian, Margaret, Brittany, Colleen, Lynn, Betsy, Leanne, student Alisha, Physio Karen and Sandy and OTs Mary and Amy and the rest of your teams in 215.  
Mr Mirghani- literally you are unlike any consultant surgeon I have ever met! You have an attitude to your work that needs to be commended like no other. You are so motivating and positive and clearly enjoy both your job and spending time with your patients with supporting them through their journey from start to finish and likely then some more!  
From the moment we spoke on the phone and you explained all mums CT scan results to me (I have a nursing background myself) I knew from your kind voice and personality that my mum was in brilliant hands! Once I had the pleasure of meeting you before and after mums operation you are clearly a man that is fully invested in your work and your patients! All of the staff love working with you and can’t help but say to how brilliant you are! I’m sure you are aware of this but it needs to be shouted from the roof tops! Thank you Mr Mirghani and your team for saving my mums life and giving her the hope and motivation she needs to carry on!  
You are all amazing and please keep it up!! You have made me realise how proud I am to work for the NHS!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: muscaps99
title: New appointment system
body:
I attended Ards minor injuries unit. I had fallen downstairs two days previously and thought I'd sprained my ankle. After two days I was still in pain & could not put pressure on it.  
An internet search showed that my nearest MIU was closed, but Ards was not. I got a lift over and the nurse explained that there is a new appointment system. I had to call my lift back.  
Please can this be made apparent or advertised?  
Many thanks to you all for your help.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: c1905
title: Amazing midwife
body: I contacted my local midwife due to my mood taking a low dip. I made contact between Christmas and new year she was so kind and offered me to go see her and to speak to my doctor about going back on to medication to help my mental health I declined at the point to see her as I thought I could handle my mood. Although a week later with more stress and anxiety I phoned again and was told to come in to speak to someone, although I got her name wrong and didn’t think I’d get to speak to her I was warmly greeted by Sarah (I think sorry if I’ve forgot again) who I’d spoke to last week and didn’t think I’d get to see. She took me through sat down and spoke through what was bothering me and reassured me about what I could do to help me and told me how I’d make a good mum when my little boy arrives she really made me feel better and even let me hear my boy for the first time, really made my day. I couldn’t have asked for a more friendly face for a chat at this busy and stressful time. I’m so thankful for her help and without speaking to her, would hate to think how worse I'd be feeling right now. Thank you so much.

author: Virgo20
title: My stay in hospital over Christmas
body: I was admitted to Ward 9 in the Ulster hospital for a week over Christmas, the care I received was outstanding from the doctors to the nurses on the ward along with staff in A& E, ultrasound and different departments,   nothing was ever a hassle to them. A special mention to Nicole and Jill who looked after me for most of my stay. On Christmas Day the staff kept everyone’s spirts high and made sure we enjoyed the day to the best we could. In the hospital durning Covid I felt safe and that the standard of care provided remained high.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: castorsd38
title: Admission to Lomond Ward, Stratheden hospital
body:
I was admitted to Lomond ward from mid October to mid December 2020. This was an emergency admission, involving a week in IPCU, initially.  
I was treated very well and given good care and support, by all staff.  
Despite the covid restrictions in place, the ward facilities and supportive environment made the situation easier to cope with.  
An increase in the recreation budget could be well used to provide some new materials for patient use.  
Many thanks to all staff on Lomond ward and IPCU.

author: KatLD
title: Birthing  experience
body: I had a very positive experience during my labour and birth despite things not going my 'ideal way' as I had laid out in the birth plan. I ended up on the induction ward, labour ward, home from home and post natal ward. The staff, however ensured to read my birth plan and where possible tried to facilitate as much of it as possible. I could not fault the staff who looked after me so well, explained options and during the labour gave my husband and I time to discuss and decide options. Covid restrictions meant that my husband was only present whilst on the labour ward, however once on post natal ward the staff where attentive and even offered to look after the baby whilst I got a shower. Aside from covid restrictions the only negative was the continuity of care throughout the pregnancy.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Caring and efficient service
body: I rang for advice yesterday and was given helpful information. This morning, as advised, I rang at 8am and after about 5 minutes I spoke to a member of staff. She listened well and obviously passed the information on in full because an hour later I received a message asking for photos to be uploaded. After a couple of other messages I received notification of a hospital appointment. This took less than 3 hours and all staff were friendly, helpful and clearly cared. It is very reassuring to know that despite the challenges of Covid-19 the surgery deals with other medical issues in a caring and efficient manner.

author: Cheyne2194
title: Birth of Baby
body: I recently gave birth to my first baby. As she was breech, I was advised to have an elective C-section. The care I received was just excellent and I can’t thank to stay at AMH enough. I was nervous about having a C-section but right from the beginning I felt I was being looked after and was put at ease from the minute we arrived. I want to thank all the theatre staff, the care was just amazing! I also want to thank all staff on Summerfield ward, the aftercare and support I received was just brilliant. I would like to put a special mention to maternity support worker Jennie and midwife Emily, who provided amazing support when my little one was put on a feeding plan due to weight loss.

author: Hapxt54
title: Excellent care
body:
My mum who is elderly and has dementia was admitted to Purley 1 and spent just over 2 weeks  
in their care over the festive period.  
The whole team were absolutely amazing including the enhanced care team - especially Charmaine.  
In these very difficult times my mum was treated with dignity and respect, and the kindness and empathy shown towards her was second to none. The staff are so committed and caring and treat all their patients professionally and with so much compassion it is heartening to see.  
It gave my family peace of mind to know that she was being cared for on that ward as we had so much confidence in the care that we saw them delivering.  
The ward sister Sandra is an amazing leader and I’m sure this has an impact on the whole team.  
Thank you again Purley 1 for all you did - keep up the excellent work.

author: giftfk69
title: Fractured ankle
body: I was sledging and broke my ankle both sides! Was in so much pain. The staff at Wishaw hospital could not have been nicer.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Excellent care
body: This is the best surgery I have ever been registered with. The receptionist is always helpful and friendly, seeking the best treatment option for you during the pandemic. Drs call back promptly and deal with concerns. Excellent all round!

title: Great practice
body:
The practice has improved greatly from the past problems caused by mismanagement. Now the systems that have been put in place make it a lot easier to get the service required. I particularly like the email system for making enquiries that saves hours hanging on to the phone while you wait to get through. I am very happy with the on line call back system so the doctor calls you to discuss your symptoms rather that going to the surgery. Of course, if it felt needed, then you will be called in. I had shingles last year but they were still able to diagnose my condition by talking through with me as well as I was able to upload a photo of my rash to establish the facts. 
To summarize I am very impressed with the systems that they are adapting due to trying circumstances and also the caring side from the medical team has seen much improvement and every doctor I have seen in the 12 months have been very impressive. I would be happy to recommend this practice

title: Excellent Receptionist
body: I have been calling the GP regularly in the last few months and I have always managed to get through to a very lovely receptionist who is extremely polite and helpful. She answers all my questions and directs me to the right service every time. It is already a very hard time for everyone and I am very grateful to her for helping us get the right advice on the phone when needed.

title: Excellent practice
body: Visited the practice first time today! Made my visit a very relaxing day,very enjoyable. Friendly staff . worked well with each  other . On time . Saw such customer on time. Gave every one a genuine one to one personal Customer service experience to suit their individual needs.

title: Excellent
body: The staff here are great. Always get a quick response, easy to find the answer I'm looking for. Reception staff are always very helpful and doctors are thorough.

title: Overall good practice
body:
I have been with this practice for many years & have found their service to be very good. I have always been able to access the facilities which I have needed. In particular the surgery are continually striving, to improve & listen to the needs & feedback which their patients provide via the various forums which are made available. Like many families this year we have needed to access GP services in several instances & for differing circumstances. On the whole we have found these services accessible & cannot fault the dedication of the team at the Maples. In particular the new appointment system has helped to meet our needs on both an individual & family level. My recent Flu jab, first ever, was just one example of how efficient & well run the services on offer are.  The continued provision & review of services, such as repeat prescriptions, is markedly better than other surgeries.
Personally & as a family we are very grateful for the continued service, dedication & support that the Maples GP practice provide.

title: Outstanding hospital with remarkable staff
body: I had a two night stay at the hospital following back surgery. The entire team were professional, accommodating and caring. Every aspect of the operation was clearly explained and the pain relief was instant following the operation. The recovery has been made easier than I anticipated thanks to the outstanding job of the surgeon and his team. I am eternally grateful to all involved in my treatment.

author: AmyNottingham
title: Stabilisation Therapy and overcoming BPD
body: I started my stabilisation therapy with Donna from Rushcliffe Mental Health Team to the end of last year. And its safe to say, she has helped me enormously. I had my sessions virtually however this did not hinder our interactions and my progress. I learnt many techniques to help with emotional stability, from mindfulness to creating an emergency box to open when in times of need. Donna has helped me to become more resilient and more stable in my emotional interactions. I feel an enormous change in my behaviour, and I genuinely think before I react now. I feel more content and in control of my emotions, and I have her to thank for that. I feel healthier and happier in my day to day relationships, and she has really helped me to start a new, fresh year with a stronger and healthier mindset. Thank you for helping me to see life for what it really is Donna. You're a star.

author: gregsop
title: Fell backwards onto back and head due to ice
body:
I had fall onto my back and head and my wife phoned 111 who sent an ambulance. The crew were brilliant. After arriving at the hospital I was seen by a doctor who advised me that I needed a head scan. I was on a board and my head was immobilized so it was a bit of an ordeal waiting. However, I was constantly updated on progress knowing the pressures all the staff are under. Atfer 5 hrs (I think) I was taken for a CT scan and pleased to say all was well  
The care shown by all the people from start to sending me home was A1. Thanks to all.

author: chamaeleondc93
title: Dermatology procedure
body: Went to Stirling hospital dermatology dept today to have biopsies taken. Alana was receptionist & put me at my ease when I arrived, then I had to see David & Rose who were doing the procedure, again I was totally at ease with them, they chatted & made me comfortable & the whole experience was completely painless & they kept me informed of every thing they did, all in all a zero traumatic experience I felt completely at ease the whole time.

author: andromedajb49
title: Coil removal
body: I was nervous about getting my coil removed as I’d never had it out Ashley the nurse was so lovely and reassuring and made the process quick and easy. Great team in sexual health Kirkcaldy

author: Feedback12
title: Sonographer
body:
I feel the need to write and compliment the outstanding care I received recently from one of your Sonographers at a recent 12 week pregnancy scan appointment.  
So far my experience with the maternity service has been poor, from my booking information being lost, it being near impossible to make any contact with the community midwife, no communication and finding myself chasing my own appointments, and then COVID meaning my partner cannot attend out 12 week scan as the room is too small...even though we were told he can attend the 20 week scan in the same room?! Other trusts updated their guidance according to the government updates, but Musgrove have not. We paid for a private scan as feel the hospital ruin this experience for expectant parents when their reasoning makes no sense.  
When I attended for my 12 week scan, apprehensive and struggling with being alone for this appointment, the sonographer was just wonderful. Super friendly, chatted through everything that would happen, took time finding the perfect pictures of our baby and explaining what could be seen. Their whole manner made such a difference to what's been a disappointing and messy journey so far.  
I am also an NHS staff member and I feel it's important to share my experience from a patient perspective. The whole experience with the midwife has been disappointing so far, which in all honestly makes me nervous for the rest of my pregnancy journey, but I feel the sonographer really did make a difference and deserves some individual recognition.

author: Mother1
title: Labour
body:
I was sent to St Johns hospital unit to give birth, as Edinburgh hospital was full. I had written in my birthplan No Epidural, No morphine but as I arrived one of the first question I met was if I want morphine. By then I was so tired and exhausted, that I have asked what to do, I simply couldn't make this decision. I knew I didn't want it but they have convinced me by saying that the labour will still be few good hours and that I need a rest. Morphine would make me fall asleep. Going with that, being already exhausted after 24h labour at home, I gave up and I took it and later I took a second dose.  
I regret this to this date, as it stopped my contractions, and I had to be put on Oxitosin drip. I believe if they had cared for my wishes and stuck to the plan - rather than offer Morphine, helped by encouraging me and believing in me I would have done it naturally.  
I had 3 different midwives during my birth, they offered no real support but just checking the vitals and telling me to push.  
After my daughter was delivered, told me to go and take a shower- on my own!  
I believe midwives are greater than what I have experienced and I should have had better treatment and help during this difficult time.

title: Colonoscopy procedure
body:
I have regular colonoscopies and came yesterday feeling very anxious and tearful due to a very traumatic colonoscopy 7 years ago. The staff put me at ease straight away as they listened to me and showed that they cared. They went the extra mile to make me feel at ease and stayed with me reassuring me the whole time. I felt incredibly well looked after and blessed by the whole team. The dr was amazing with explaining everything to me and helping me to understand some things I have never been told before. I feel you have taken some of my fears and anxiety away and will be asking if i can PLEASE come back to you in 3 years time. Thank you so much. I can’t explain how much the whole team worked so well together, supporting one another and caring in such a beautiful way. You truly are amazing. 
Thank you so very much. You made a horrible painful procedure more bearable than it ever has been before.

title: Cannot fault the staff here
body:
I spoke to an extremely helpful, friendly and jolly receptionist who said I would receive a telephone consultation on a certain day, which I did.  My GP was again absolutely amazing, extremely friendly, helpful and asked me if I was happy with what she proposed.
I have only been with this surgery for about 2 years and always received such excellent, treatment, advice and they all seem to genuinely care. Cannot fault any of the staff. Thank you Hawthorn Drive Surgery!

title: Catering Practice
body:
I recently had to contact the practice with severe pains. As we are in COVID the receptionist said that I would get a call from the doctor. The doctor rang me in a very short time. She was very thorough and concerned to the extent that she was prepared to come out to see me. I declined the offer saying I would give the medication she prescribed a chance to work. She stressed that if there was no improvement I was to contact the surgery immediately. 
I have also since then had to speak to a receptionist for advice and I have always found them to be helpful, courteous and polite. 
I understand that under this COVID situation the practice must be under a lot of pressure and I cannot thank or recommend them enough.

title: Really helpful
body: A really helpful and reassuring telephone consultation with someone who had enough time to talk to me in detail.

title: So Caring
body: During this difficult time, time was found to examine and talk me through my health problem. Wonderful Doctor.

title: Efficient and friendly service
body:
I would like to thank the staff in the phlebotomy department for their friendly and efficient service.
They are always great

title: A difficult practice to like
body: Up until 15 years ago this was a great practice, and I had a doctor I liked and trusted implicitly. Since he left I have been allocated a number of new doctors, none of whom seem to stay long, and none whom I had much faith in. If I make an appointment now, I make it with one of the nurse specialists or the nurse practitioner - these are so good, professional and knowledgeable. So far as actually making an appointment is concerned, this process is horrendous. On telephoning the practice, many times I just get the recorded response “we are too busy - call back later”. When I do get through, I usually have to wait for at least ten minutes, listening to some awful screeching “music”: my longest wait to date is just over 50 minutes, and the queue was only 7 long to start with! I tried to contact the practice manager a couple of times, to find out what was going on. Both times I was told “oh, he’s not in today”.

title: Appalling Service
body:
Today I have tried to contact the surgery 3 times. The phone was answered 3 times and put straight back down. How the hell am I going to get my fathers heart medication as recommended by the hospital. I will be going and ringing the bell until I get an answer.

Clearly seriously under resourced.

title: Inhumane and degrading patient treatment
body:
If you want an appointment with a doctor, forget it at this place. You're left redialling and redialling at 08.00:01 seconds, just so they can hit their same-day appointment targets for more funding. Obviously the doctor's bagging £100k+/year each isn't sufficient to prevent this practice practising its' practices. They used to have 25 places in a call-waiting queue, then pretended customers surveyed wanted to not get through at all, rather than wait in a queue, so they cut the ''service'' to only 10 waiting spaces which is absolutely useless.
The doctors are generally good to be fair (with an odd exception), though they have too many patients for their staff-chosen systems to cope with on a case-handling basis, which is only tilted in the practices' favour. 
If you seriously want reliable ACCESS to a doctor, avoid this place like the plague

title: Okay but bad receptionists
body:
Actual medical treatment absolutely fine. Not better or worse than I've had elsewhere.

The receptionists are really unhelpful though, especially in the phone. They talk down to you and have zero sympathy/contrition when they give you bad advice that later causes you inconvenience.

title: Know your GP
body:
I have had good experiences at Leeds Road Practice and I admire the way they have responded to provide a good service in the Pandemic.
On the website very little detail is available about the GP team - how do I get to know more about my doctors?

title: Lovely practice
body: I have recently joined the practice and found them to be efficient, kind and caring. From the lovely reception/ admin support teams, to the clinical team I have found nothing but a passion for caring for their patients and going the extra mile. In these difficult times they have gone out of their way to ensure the safety and well-being of patients which shows their dedication to the public. Really proud to be a patient here and recommend them if you are looking for a professional yet caring practice. 10/10 from me and I’m glad to have my health in your hands!

title: Great practice
body:
Tregenna have been fantastic and persistent with me since I have been problematic. The online service I personally prefer as i know many others that suffer socially will also. 
Brilliant

title: Excellent service and support
body:
My wife and I have been extremely impressed with both the service - in terms of promptness - and support in terms of effective advice and medical care.  We have been very well aware of the pressures created by the pandemic that the practice has been under during this year but have always found that at all levels - from reception of phone calls to speed of response from a doctor or nurse to outcomes from those responses have been excellent. 

In all situations, we have found the practice responsive, efficient, effective and, just as importantly to us, approachable and friendly.  They always have been but in this extremely challenging year, despite the difficulties, they have maintained what we feel to be an excellent service.

title: Great practice
body: I’ve been registered at this practice for over 15 years. I’ve always received excellent care from the GPs & reception staff.

title: Outstanding practice
body:
I had a phone consultation with my GP  today and she gave outstanding support and really helped me with my concerns. She listened really well to my worries and gave me reassurance and solutions. Thank you for your brilliant practice! 
The receptionist is always really helpful, kind and caring. 
Thank you

title: Practice is a Disgrace
body: Rude receptionists who do not understand or do not want to help. It is impossible to get an appointment and you cannot ever speak to the practice manager. This is the worst doctors I have ever dealt with and I am in the process of transferring to a different practice.  Do not register with this surgery!

title: Feels Safe
body: They have always looked after me brilliantly. They have fantastic, well trained staff. During the pandemic they've been great every time I've visited. The place is clean, you can stay away from people and still get the care you need.

title: lovely people, disorganised communications
body: I have had two great conversations with practice team today, one with a lovely GP and one with a lovely receptionist. However the website is awful. I would really like to give some detailed feedback to the website builder about it. Is that possible?

title: Excellent practice
body: Very professional excellent surgery always aware of patients needs and the service they provide is first class never a problem when you want to book an appointmentNever rushed at your appointments and feel that you are being listened to and you are getting the best care possible

title: Pain Management
body: I Joined the 6 week online Pain Management Program in November 2020 was sceptical at first but being with other members of the group discussing our  pain and looking at different ways and solutions to the pain has helped me understand my pain better I suffer from chronic pain which has proved difficult to manage. Through the online sessions I was able to look at other ways to manage my pain. Now doing some gentle exercises like sitting down Tie Chi has not cured the pain but has been a help for me.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Need to fix your phone lines.
body:
Looking at the reviews about your practice and your responses.. you've had problems with your phone lines for about 3 years now? That's not reassuring that you're getting the problem fixed.
I had some tests done at hospital over the Christmas period, I've been calling every day the past few weeks, in the ques for hours.. the number either never lowers or it just rings and rings and rings..
What are patients expected to do?

title: Always Great
body: The whole of this practice needs to be recognised, Docs, Paramedics and Receptionists. ALWAYS had patience, politeness and clear understanding with brilliant Receptionist before being advised whether Doc's phone back is necessary. These Doc's calls have been prompt with treatment on it's way! I had need for all these people prior, and after Christmas, and can't thank them enough.

title: Impersonal, unsupportive and unengaged
body: Despite new guidance saying birth partners should be allowed to come to maternity appointments the trust will not allow it as rooms are too small. Birth partners are also only allowed to spend two hours with partner and babies after birth and each subsequent day in hospital. This is exceeding stressful for mothers and damaging to the bonding process of babies with partners and families. All appointments have been impersonal, with no continuity of care in the midwife team, no one wishes to answer any questions or justify decisions made and explain options available. Instead it is just decided for patients. This has caused me a great deal of anxiety and when flagged to the midwife no action was taken, instead I had to refer myself for mental health support.

title: They just don’t seem to care!
body: When phoning in you’re lucky or unlucky-you will either get a helpful person or one who doesn’t care. We’ve been waiting for my dads diabetic review and we’ve finally got a HomeKit and done this. Called to ask when they’ll arrange the blood test and it’s been overlooked by the person tasked to do it because she’s dealing with COVID tests, why should my dad “be forgotten” - maybe get more staff? Yes there is a pandemic but there are still other patients that have medical needs that still need to be addressed-since moving from Hanway your standards seems to have dropped drastically. Get more staff if you need to, don’t make your patients suffer because of your lack of organisation!!!

title: Overview of 4 visits to Urology over the past 3…
body: After a referral  under the "two week rule" I have visited Urology and/or Ultrasound 4 times in the past 3 months (03/11/2020, 25/11/2020, 04/12/2020 & 05/01/2021)  Without exception, the staff I have come into contact with have been cheerful, kind and caring, and the treatment I have received has been delivered punctually and in a highly professional manner. Given the pressures the NHS is under at present I cannot praise my experience at WGH too highly

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Experience
body: Parking ticket received we have a disable badge and was told by kings to attend no one mentioned you couldnt park service was great but needs to be a big sign in the carpark or in reception no one in reception when we attended gave our name to a nurse

title: Online consultations
body: I am curious why Grayshott Surgery does not offer E-consult or video consults.  It is also not possible to book an appointment online.

title: Great staff BUT
body:
The staff are great but the toilets were very dirty.
Toilets were left un flushed and there was toilet paper over the seats and on the floor.
The Injection waiting room was very busy with no room to social distancing.  Two things that could be addressed to make visits better.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I had my prostate removed on October 9th 2020. I would like to state that I am extremely pleased with the treatment that I have received at all stages of the process.  All of the staff in the Urology cancer unit were friendly, communicative and caring. The surgeon called my wife immediately after the operation to confirm that it was successful, and called me twice at home to check my progress.  The Clinical Nurse Specialists provided great support pre/post-operation and helped reassure me during a difficult time. The Admission Lounge is also manned by caring staff who helped to make the pre-operation preparation process less stressful. I cannot speak too highly of the efficiency of all the staff, at no stage did I have to chase anybody for information; which has not been my experience at other hospitals.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust
Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Disappointed!!!
body: I’m extremely annoyed with the practice today. My parents who are in their 80s have attended the surgery  for an appointment with a nurse to be told it has been cancelled. They have received no notification of this. My mother who has dementia and has been coaxed into attending is really upset. I know it’s a difficult time at the moment but I find this unacceptable.   She now has to wait another 9 days for another appointment.  I have also had to take time of work to transport then to the surgery which I don’t mind but for a wasted journey it’s a joke.

title: First Class Surgery
body: My mum has always been looked after exceptionally well but in November she became really poorly and her prompt treatment by the Doctor, Nurses and support from receptionists just underlined how fortunate she is to be with the Harlequin surgery.

title: Very supportive, caring staff
body: I've had to see my GP surgery a few times over the last year and have spoken with 3 GPs and a nurse and found them all to be caring, empathic, supportive and knowledgeable, all of this whilst working in spite of Covid too. I just wanted to say thank you.

title: Epic experience
body:
Enormous thanks to Stoneygate eye hospital friendly atmosphere pain free super service had one eye done 2020 and the other 1st jan 2021 would recommend anyone needing cataract op visit 
this super friendly  practice felt at ease within five min of entering 

Pete v

title: Hard to contact
body: GPs are very good but trying to get through to the secretaries/receptionist is almost impossible at times (not just in COVID times). So many times I’ve called and an automated message says I’m ‘first in the queue’ then I’m abruptly cut off with a message that they have too many calls to answer. Even this evening the doctor put me through to reception and I heard someone pick up and hang up on me!!

title: Great médical staff
body:
Unfortunately I need to use the practice regularly due to a serious illness. I cannot praise the medical staff highly enough: doctors, nurses, healthcare assistants. All caring, friendly and helpful.
However, I too have encountered some hostile and unhelpful attitudes from reception staff.

title: Christmas in hospital with covid
body:
Thank you for doing your best to make a jolly Christmas in a Covid time where things are not jolly.
Playing games and singing with nurses and doctors was a good tonic to make best of bad Christmas Day. Looking after us and not being with your own families is sacrifice but done with a smile.
 Thank you to Santa for the drink and cake what a lovely thing to do

title: Poor communication
body: The published hours for the surgery are not helpful. Not all types of staff and facilities are available during the published hours. For example test results are not available after 6pm even though the surgery says it is open until 7pm (Tuesday) This could easily be communicated via an up to date website, notices in the practice, notes on forms given to patients or even by word of mouth when the staff speak to patients.

title: Not what it was.
body: We have been with this practice since the late 1960s. ```It is no longer a family practise, you are constantly aware that you are a number to be ticked off, not an intelligent human being.

title: Better appointment system
body: Have been in surgery since 1958, as years have gone on it's almost impossible to get to see the same go, so you have to explain your symptoms again. These days you wait for ages in a queue, then told no appointments phone after 8am, which for some people it's impossible. Not a lot of people have internet or know how to use it. Since lockdown I've had various problems which is made it difficult for me to see a Dr. I know we're all having problems with this virus, but try and make it as easy as possible for your patience to get some satisfaction, and give them appointments.

title: brilliant  practice
body: I have  been with  this practice  for 53 years and been  very  satisfied  with all of the services  that was offered,Doctor's,nurses and receptionist. Nothing  as not been  any trouble, also the administration  side is very good..

title: Poor customer service
body: Not good at all very poor customer service or receptionist not providing You useful information every time we call them they are so unprofessional and unfriendly

title: Excellent practice
body:
The service I have received from this practice is excellent, reception staff are very helpful even if there aren’t any appointments available for the same day and it’s something that can’t wait they will get a doctor to call back. The text alerts received by the practice to keep us aware of any appointments or changes to the practice times are very good.
The doctors are re assuring and very approachable. I would
